result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Jeremy L Howard not in court.  Attorney Robert J Hampton III appeared by video for Jeremy L Howard.  Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Case set for status conference.  No appearance by the defendant.  Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed until the next court date. Case adjourned to Br. 1.
Calendar call scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Scheduling conference held.  Defendant was in court but thinks he has Covid and was told to leave.  Atty. Hampton needs the file from prior counsel and requests a status date.Case is adjourned to Br. 1. This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.

Court ordered defendant to post an additonal $250 cash.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Jeremy LilPearl Howard in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Defendant Jeremy LilPearl Howard in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jeremy LilPearl Howard appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 01.  This hearing may be streamed live at the Court's discretion on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/83289ee0-2326-3076-b9a3-4c551cf64527  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jeremy LilPearl Howard not in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Milwaukee County Sheriff's Office has cleared the active warrant, provided the next court date to the defendant, and requested the warrant be withdrawn with approval of Deputy Chief Judge Carl Ashley. MCSO advised defendant to appear in Room 221 of the Safety Building, in person, at 1:00 PM on 9/16/2022.
  Return on warrant scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  Court ordered no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Jeremy LilPearl Howard in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Defendant Jeremy LilPearl Howard in custody.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jeremy LilPearl Howard appeared by video means with Attorney.
  Defendant is advised this case is re-assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1 due to defendant's lower pending case. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
